alert.note: Alert for Northwest Deserts; Northwest Plateau (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 15 at 1:35PM MST until January 17 at 5:00PM MST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST TUESDAY ABOVE 5500 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow above 5500 feet. Additional snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches in the Northwest Plateau with lesser amounts in the Hualapai Mountains. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Northwest Plateau and Northwest Deserts. * WHEN...Until 4 PM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be hazardous. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... Accumulating snow between 2 and 4 inches is possible on Buck and Doe Road as well as 3 to 6 inches on Hualapai Mountain Road, resulting in hazardous road conditions.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather conditions will make travel very hazardous or impossible. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
